author: Staff Reporter
text:
More than 20,000 candidates took part in the Combined Civil Services Examination held at over 110 centres in the district on Sunday.

A release from the district administration said that 21,125 of the 31,400 candidates appeared for the Group II exam, held from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.

They wrote the exam at 110 centres, each of which had a chief invigilator.

The district administration had made arrangements for the smooth conduct of the examination by operating special buses to the 66 schools and colleges that housed the 110 centres. With support from the police, it had posted personnel to ensure security at the exam centres.

In addition to the 110 chief invigilators, the district administration had also deputed tahsildars to be mobile coordinators and formed nine flying squads, the release adds quoting Collector Archana Patnaik, who had visited the exam centre at Presentation Convent.
title: Over 20,000 candidates appear for Group II exam
